title: Democrats See Warning Signs for Biden in Tight Virginia Governor’s Race
sub_head: They say state likely offers best snapshot of the party’s standing and could set tone for midterm elections next year
body:
FAIRFAX, Va.—A tightening governor’s race in Virginia is stirring concerns among Democrats who see the contest as a barometer for President Biden’s political fortunes as he struggles to pass an ambitious agenda and prepares to try to maintain his party’s control in Congress.
Democrat Terry McAuliffe is trying to buck a historical trend in which the president’s party has struggled in his state’s gubernatorial races, even as Americans grapple with the pandemic, higher energy prices and supply-chain backups. People close to the White House have expressed worries about whether the former Virginia governor, who is making a comeback bid, can defeat Republican Glenn Youngkin in the Nov. 2 election.
